content.text: Story Setup

Your hero has awakened, but the villagers are whispering:
"Who is this traveler? How strong are they? Do they even have any coins?"
Every hero needs stats to prove themselves:
In Python, we use variables to keep track of these stats.
Tags Introduced
What is a Variable?
A variable is like a labeled chest where you store information.

hero_name = "Aria"
hero_hp = 100
hero_name -> holds the hero's name (string of text) hero_hp -> holds the hero's health points (number)
Variables can change during the adventure.

hero_hp = 100
print(hero_hp)   # 100

hero_hp = 80     # hero takes damage
print(hero_hp)   # 80
Just like your HP bar in a video game - it updates as you take damage or heal.

lessons.title: Hero Training Drill 1 - Count Your Coins

content.text: Hero Training Drill 1 - Count Your Coins
The guild asks: "How rich is your hero?"
Create a variable hero_coins = 20. Print: "Your hero jingles 20 shiny coins."

content.solution:
hero_coins = 20
print("Your hero jingles", hero_coins, "shiny coins.")
hints: Use print() with commas to combine text and numbers

content.text: Data Types
Not all variables are the same kind. Heroes have many types of stats.

items: bool -> True/False (alive or dead, door open or shut)

content.text:
hero_level = 3        # int
hero_attack = 12.5    # float
hero_name = "Kai"     # str
hero_alive = True     # bool
Advanced Note - Checking Types

print(type(hero_attack))   # <class 'float'>
print(type(hero_name))     # <class 'str'>
This is like asking the guild scribe: "What kind of stat is written here?"

lessons.title: Hero Training Drill 2 - Show Your Stats

content.text: Hero Training Drill 2 - Show Your Stats
The guild master demands: "Tell me your level and your magic power!"
Create hero_level = 3 (int). Create hero_magic = 5.5 (float). Print both stats in one line.

content.solution:
hero_level = 3
hero_magic = 5.5
print("Hero Level:", hero_level, "| Hero Magic:", hero_magic)
hints: Create two variables with different types

lessons.title: Hero Training Drill 3 - Alive or Dead

content.text: Hero Training Drill 3 - Alive or Dead
The guild healer asks: "Is the hero alive?"
Create a variable hero_alive = True. Print: "Is the hero alive? True"

content.solution:
hero_alive = True
print("Is the hero alive?", hero_alive)
hints: Create a boolean variable: hero_alive = True
Use print() to display the question and answer

content.text: Print - The Hero's Voice
The print() function is your hero's voice. You can use it to shout names, numbers, or even entire profiles.

hero_name = "Kai"
hero_hp = 100
print("Hero:", hero_name, "| HP:", hero_hp)
Output:
Hero: Kai | HP: 100
Advanced Note - Printing Different Types Together
print("Hero alive?", True, "| HP:", 100)
Output:
Hero alive? True | HP: 100

lessons.title: Hero Training Drill 4 - Announce Your Weapon

content.text: Hero Training Drill 4 - Announce Your Weapon
The villagers ask: "What weapon do you carry?"
Create hero_weapon = "Wooden Sword". Print: "Kai grabs a Wooden Sword!"

content.solution:
hero_weapon = "Wooden Sword"
print("Kai grabs a", hero_weapon + "!")
hints: Create a string variable for the weapon
Use print() with comma or + to combine text
Remember to add the exclamation mark

content.text: Challenge Quest - The Hero Card
Story: The guild refuses to admit you unless you present your official Hero Card. This card must show your hero's stats clearly.

items: Your Mission: Create a program that prints a hero profile card with:

content.expected_output:
Hero Card
---------
Name: Kai
HP: 100
Attack: 7.5
Alive: True
content.solution:
hero_name = "Kai"
hero_hp = 100
hero_attack = 7.5
hero_alive = True

print("Hero Card")
print("---------")
print("Name:", hero_name)
print("HP:", hero_hp)
print("Attack:", hero_attack)
print("Alive:", hero_alive)
hints: Create four variables with different data types
Use multiple print() statements for formatting
Include the header and separator line

content.text: By the end of Week 2:

items: Kids understand what variables are and how to update them.
They know the four main data types (int, float, str, bool).
They can use print() to display stats in story format.
Their hero now has an official Hero Card to show the guild.

content.text: Next week: the villagers want to talk to your hero directly. We'll use input() and friendly output to let the player choose names, coins, and powers.

lessons.title: Week 2 Remedial Lesson - Hero Stats Training

content.text: This remedial lesson gives extra practice for students struggling with Week 2 concepts. Each section is standalone, so you can study only the tags you need help with.
Variable - Concept Review

A variable is like a labeled chest where you can store information. The label is the variable name, and inside is the value. You can change the value during the game, just like your HP bar can go up and down.
Examples

hero_name = "Lira"
hero_hp = 150
Here, hero_name holds text (a string), while hero_hp holds a number (an integer).

hero_hp = 150
print(hero_hp)

hero_hp = 120
print(hero_hp)
First the hero has 150 HP, then 120 after taking damage.
Practice Drills for Variable

Task: Create a variable hero_coins = 35. Print: The hero carries 35 coins.
Drill V2 - The Changing Torch

items: Then set torch_light = 60 and print it again.

hints: Create the variable and print it
Reassign the variable to a new value

content.text: Drill V3 - Your Own Chest

hints: Combine text and variable in print()
content.solution:

content.text: DataType - Concept Review

items: Not all variables are the same type. Different stats use different data types:

content.text: Examples

hero_level = 4     # int
hero_speed = 2.75  # float
hero_name = "Orin"  # str

These variables show different types of hero stats.
print(type(hero_speed))  # <class 'float'>
Practice Drills for DataType
Drill D1 - Levels and Magic
Task: Create hero_level = 6 (int) and hero_magic = 12.5 (float). Print them together: Level and Magic.

hints: Create one int and one float variable
content.solution:

hero_magic = 12.5
print("Level:", hero_level, "| Magic:", hero_magic)

content.text: Drill D2 - Alive Check
Task: Create hero_alive = True. Print: Is hero alive? True

hints: Use a boolean value (True or False)

print("Is hero alive?", hero_alive)

content.text: Drill D3 - Create Your Own Stats
Task: Create one variable of each type (int, float, str, bool). Print them all in one block.

content.expected_output:
Name: Elin
HP: 90
Speed: 4.3
Alive: False
hints: Print each on a separate line
content.solution:
hero_name = "Elin"
hero_hp = 90

print("Name:", hero_name)

content.text: Print - Concept Review
The print() function is the hero's voice. It can speak words, numbers, or booleans. You can combine them with commas to form a message.
Examples

hero_name = "Taro"
hero_hp = 75
print("Hero:", hero_name, "| HP:", hero_hp)
Output: Hero: Taro | HP: 75
print("Hero alive?", False, "| Coins:", 10)
Output: Hero alive? False | Coins: 10
Practice Drills for Print
Drill P1 - Shout Your Weapon
Task: Create hero_weapon = "Bronze Axe". Print: The hero swings a Bronze Axe!

content.expected_output: The hero swings a Bronze Axe!
content.solution:
hero_weapon = "Bronze Axe"
print("The hero swings a", hero_weapon + "!")

content.text: Drill P2 - Hero Profile
Task: Create hero_name = "Sora", hero_hp = 60. Print both in one line: Hero: Sora | HP: 60

content.solution:
hero_name = "Sora"
hero_hp = 60
print("Hero:", hero_name, "| HP:", hero_hp)

content.text: Drill P3 - Make Your Own Announcement
Task: Create at least three variables (name, HP, item). Print them in one creative line.

content.expected_output: Sora with 60 HP equips a Bronze Axe
hints: Be creative with your sentence structure
content.solution:
hero_name = "Sora"
hero_hp = 60
hero_item = "Bronze Axe"
print(hero_name, "with", hero_hp, "HP equips a", hero_item)

content.text: Variable + DataType + Print - Integrated Practice
Sometimes you need to use all three together - store values in variables, give them the right type, and use print() to show them.

content.expected_output:

---------
Name: Ayla
HP: 95
Attack: 8.2
Alive: True
hints: Create four variables with different types
content.solution:
hero_name = "Ayla"
hero_hp = 95
hero_attack = 8.2
hero_alive = True

print("Hero Card")
print("---------")
print("Name:", hero_name)
print("HP:", hero_hp)
print("Attack:", hero_attack)
print("Alive:", hero_alive)
